oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Medicare: how it all began
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mathews, Charles R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Claude Pepper Library, Florida State University, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Document typed by Charles R. Mathews concerning the presidential meeting for the implementation of Medicare in 1966. The document describes how Mathews was initially persuaded to support Medicare and his duty to spread his knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid to others.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicare.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Charles R. Mathews Papers on Medicare Implementation, 1964-2008--http://fsuarchon.fcla.edu/index.php?p=accessions/accession&id=23&q=mathews

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Document received at presidential meeting on the implementation of Medicare listing those who attended the meeting. Charles R. Mathews is found on page five.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicare.
Washington (D.C.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Charles R. Mathews Papers on Medicare Implementation, 1964-2008--http://fsuarchon.fcla.edu/index.php?p=accessions/accession&id=23&q=mathews

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Program received at the presidential meeting on Medicare implementation listing the honorary committee members, the members of the Health Insurance Benefits Advisory Council, and the events taking place on June 15, 1966.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health Insurance Benefits Advisory Council (U.S.)
Medicare.
Washington (D.C.)

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Putting Medicare into effect
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Department of Health and Human Services
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Claude Pepper Library, Florida State University, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Document received at the presidential meeting on Medicare implementation describing how hospitals participate, how the government will be implementing Medicare, the new internal operations system, Medicare's compliance with the Civil Rights Act of 1964, and how to solve problems associated with Medicare.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicare--Handbooks, manuals, etc.
Washington (D.C.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Charles R. Mathews Papers on Medicare Implementation, 1964-2008--http://fsuarchon.fcla.edu/index.php?p=accessions/accession&id=23&q=mathews

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Remarks of President Johnson at the meeting of medical and hospital leaders
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Office of the White House Press Secretary
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Claude Pepper Library, Florida State University, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Typed copy of President Lyndon B. Johnson's speech at the presidential meeting on Medicare implementation. The speech addresses how knowledge of Medicare has been spread so far and that doctors and hospitals must now teach patients about Medicare benefits.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicare.
Johnson, Lyndon B. (Lyndon Baines), 1908-1973.
Washington (D.C.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Charles R. Mathews Papers on Medicare Implementation, 1964-2008.--http://fsuarchon.fcla.edu/index.php?p=accessions/accession&id=23&q=mathews

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Document reprinted from the Journal of the American Medical Association that explains the prohibiting of discrimination in hospitals due to the Civil Rights Act.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States. Public Health Service. Office of the Surgeon General
Medicare.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Charles R. Mathews Papers on Medicare Implementation, 1964-2008--http://fsuarchon.fcla.edu/index.php?p=accessions/accession&id=23&q=mathews

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Department of Health and Human Services

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Note given to the guests at the presidential meeting on Medicare implementation informing them that the location of a previously scheduled event has been moved. The note also informs the guests on transportation, luggage check, name badges, and the times of their meetings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicare.
Washington (D.C.)
